intro: Lecanthus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky flowers that are often blue or purple in color. The plants typically grow in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. Lecanthus species are perennial herbs that can thrive in harsh maritime environments. Their unique morphology and ecological niche make them an interesting subject for botanical study.
